article.headline: Dow and S&P 500 staging powerful Monday reversal and are aiming for biggest U-turn into positive territory in 3 months
article.body: The S&P 500 and the Dow industrials have reversed course midday Monday as the stock market attempts to recoup sharp opening losses to push into the green The S&P 500 SPX, +0.87% had been down by as much as 2.49% at Monday's low, and if it turns positive, it would be the largest rebound since March 19 when it was down 3.27%, but closed up 0.47%. The Dow Jones Industrial Average DJIA, +0.56% also was trading tentatively higher after declining nearly 3% at the start of Monday trade and would also mark its sharpest rebound since March 19, if it were to finish the day in the green. The Nasdaq Composite Index COMP, +1.39%, meanwhile, reversed course earlier than its peer benchmarks and is on pace of its biggest rebound since May 27, if its finishes in the green. The Nasdaq had been down 1.94% earlier but is now up 0.7%. Markets are bouncing back from opening losses that had been prompted at least partly by growing concerns about a resurgence of cases of COVID-19 in the U.S. and in China, where the deadly infection was first identified.
